entry.title: AI-innovations in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025
entry.content:
The release of SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 marks a significant leap forward in enterprise automation and intelligence, as presented in this product blog by @BeSchulze. This release, the result of two years of focused development, places artificial intelligence at the core – seamlessly integrated across business areas to redefine how work gets done.

Central to this update is the new agentic AI framework, where task-specific agents work together under the orchestration of our copilot Joule. More than just assistance, SAP’s persona-based AI acts as the new interface – guiding users through processes, answering questions, and delivering relevant insights within the tools they use every day. Customers can now experience improved transparency, faster decision-making, and simplified operations, with intelligent capabilities integrated directly into their business flow.

Dive into the accompanying video for a glimpse of how these AI-driven capabilities are transforming daily work and setting a new benchmark for enterprise management.

 

 

Agentic Use cases

Asset Management: Maintenance Planner

In the area of Asset Management, planning maintenance activities often requires seamless access to the right tools at the right time. The Maintenance Planner feature, newly integrated with Joule, enhances this process by providing direct navigation to scheduling applications within SAP S/4HANA Asset Management. This innovation means that maintenance planners no longer need to sift through catalogs, as they can intuitively access relevant apps directly from their conversations, such as asking, "How to visualize maintenance work?" and receiving immediate links to resource scheduling applications. By embedding SAP Help documentation into Joule’s conversational responses, planners gain quick insights and can focus more on optimally scheduling maintenance tasks, thus ensuring that assets are well-managed without the hassle of navigation detours.

Eager to learn more? Check out our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Finance: Simpliyfying invoice dispute with the dispute manager

Untangling an incorrect invoice can feel like detective work, searching for clues across different systems. Now, with the Dispute Manager agent in SAP Cloud ERP Private your finance team has a new partner. A finance expert can simply ask Joule to pull up a dispute case by its number or show recent invoices for a customer. From that single conversation, they can review the details and then instruct Joule to either reject the dispute or navigate them directly to the app to create a credit note. This conversational approach turns a complex, multi-step investigation into a streamlined and guided dialogue. It not only saves valuable time for your team but also leads to quicker resolutions, helping maintain positive customer relationships.

For more information, please refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance: Empowering Trade Classification with an AI Agent  

Imagine trying to import a new fitness tracker and facing a complex web of customs classifications, where one wrong choice could mean costly delays. The Joule Agent for Trade Classification in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 makes this task straightforward by analyzing your product's data against global customs rules. For example, it might conclude a fitness tracker falls under the wristwatches category and provide legal notes to back this decision, keeping your team informed and in control. By transforming the complex classification process into a guided interaction, your trade professionals have more time to focus on strategy rather than paperwork. This not only enhances the speed and accuracy of your compliance processes but also strengthens your ability to meet market demands swiftly. With this AI innovation, your business can confidently and efficiently pursue global growth, minimizing delays and maximizing opportunities.

To learn more, consult our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Sales LoB

Elevating sales efficiency with AI-driven solution quotation management

Speaking of the Sales line of business, where time is of the essence, managing solution quotations can be a complex task. The introduction of Joule as a digital assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 simplifies this process by allowing sales reps to execute tasks like creation, updating, and searching of solution quotations with conversational, natural language commands. This empowers sales teams to focus on high-value opportunities, such as quotations about to expire or those with significant client interest, and make well-informed decisions with clarity and speed. By streamlining the access to critical information, Joule helps reduce operational time and enhances the agility of sales professionals, allowing them to concentrate on building stronger customer relationships and fulfilling sales targets.

 

 

For more information read our dedicated pages on performing release and acceptance of solution quotations and fetching solution quotation information.

 

Seamlessly creating billing documents with AI

Imagine transforming the intricate process of billing document creation into an efficient, effortless operation—this is where Joule steps in. The AI-powered capabilities of Joule allow users to effortlessly generate billing documents, whether they stem from a single reference or a collection of sales and delivery documents. This intuitive system supports the creation of both individual and collective billing documents, tailored to meet diverse business needs with pinpoint accuracy. For R&D departments, this means a streamlined workflow where administrative overhead is minimized, allowing more focus on innovation and product development. By simplifying navigation and enabling quick access to essential apps like Display Billing Documents, Joule enhances the accuracy and efficiency of billing processes, paving the way for more strategic decision-making. With this kind of intelligent assistance, your team spends less time on the nitty-gritty and more time driving the business forward.

 For more details, consult the SAP Help Portal.

 

Sourcing & Procurement LoB

AI-assisted creation of purchase requisitions 

Let’s take a look at the Sourcing & Procurement Line of Business. In this area creating purchase requisitions is a task that demands accuracy and efficiency. With the AI-assisted capabilities of Joule, the process becomes intuitive, allowing users, particularly casual ones, to navigate and complete requisitions merely through conversational prompts. This smart assistance helps in understanding various languages, correcting misspelled data, and even suggesting sources of supply promptly, thereby minimizing manual overhead and enhancing speed in decision-making. By embracing the future potential of speech recognition, Joule promises to make procurement tasks even more seamless, supporting operational purchasers in reducing free text entries and ensuring order clarity.

 For more details, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance LoB

Simplified subscription order management*

In Finance, is often fragmented and error-prone. Teams spend valuable time reconciling contracts, processing changes, and ensuring compliance - effort that slows down financial operations and puts transparency at risk.

Joule tackles this challenge by simplifying subscription management end to end. It guides users through creating orders, automatically filling key fields once core details are entered. Contract information is easy to access and aligned with attributes like customer or product ID, while intuitive summaries provide quick snapshots of activation status. By streamlining these steps, Joule boosts efficiency, improves transparency, and allows businesses to focus on growth rather than administrative tasks.

 

For more information, consult the SAP Help Portal.  

 

Joule for cash management assistant*

Picture your finance team, once bogged down in manual cash flow tracking, now effortlessly navigating a sea of numbers with ease. With Joule, you can quickly verify if due bank statements are received, fetch opening balances, and factor in expected cash flows, all in one seamless process. By providing accurate calculations of expected closing balances, Joule proactively alerts you to potential cash shortages or surpluses. This efficiency not only saves substantial time but also empowers you to optimize cash usage strategically. In a world where timing is everything, having this level of clarity allows your business to maintain a robust financial footing and seize opportunities as they arise. 

 

 

For more details, refer to the SAP Help Portal. 

*planned availability in November 2025  with the  update of Joule framework

Supply Chain LoB

Joule navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management

In managing warehouse operations, finding the right tools quickly can make all the difference between seamless or sluggish performance. With the introduction of Joule copilot navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management, SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 enhances user experience by guiding employees effortlessly to the most suitable applications for their tasks. This AI-driven assistance not only accelerates warehouse processes but also minimizes the need for extensive user training, ensuring employees can focus on their core responsibilities rather than app navigation. The real value lies in the comprehensive insights this innovation provides, empowering users to make informed decisions that enhance efficiency across operations.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Service Management LoB

Creating follow-ups for in-house service objects with Joule

Now let’s have a look at the Service Management LoB. Here, Joule's AI-driven capabilities enable service managers to easily search, display, and create follow-ups for in-house service objects using conversational interactions. This human-centric approach optimizes daily tasks by allowing managers to seamlessly access critical information and act upon it without the need for complex navigation. By streamlining these processes, service management teams can focus on what truly matters—delivering quality service to their customers. Such enhancements in task efficiency lead to more responsive service operations, ensuring a proactive approach toward managing service demands.

 

 

For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Research and Development LoB

Intelligent project assistant capabilities with Joule

Navigating through a sea of data is commonplace in Research and Development (R&D) area, yet it doesn't have to be a drain on your team's creativity and productivity. The intelligent project assistant capabilities powered by Joule allow users to derive project data through natural language inquiries without the hassle of navigating multiple applications. This ease of access aids in quickly retrieving updates on project changes, identifying missing parts, and tracking due activities, all through Joule’s conversational interface. By supporting informational, navigational, and transactional capabilities, Joule transforms project management into a streamlined process, helping teams stay focused on innovation rather than administrative tasks. Moreover, the ability to open projects and WBS elements directly through Joule means that users can engage with their data more efficiently, fostering a productive and satisfied work environment. With these enhancements, businesses can ensure that their R&D projects are not only well managed but also effectively advancing toward their goals.

 

Navigating Bill of Materials with Joule

Imagine a workspace, where accessing Bill of Materials (BoM) is as straightforward as asking a colleague for the latest update, that's the seamless interaction Joule brings to the table. This AI-assisted natural language capability supports end users in navigating and managing BoM scenarios with ease, removing previous barriers to information. With Joule, users can effortlessly access header information, query BoMs by material-plant combinations, and select specific items, all through simple conversational prompts. Such simplification boosts productivity, allowing R&D teams to devote more time to product innovation and less to administrative navigation. By transforming BoM management into an intuitive, efficient process, Joule empowers users to make informed decisions, enhancing operational efficiency and ultimately driving business success.

For more information, refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

AI-Enabled Precision in Handling Change Records

In Research and Development, managing change records is often time-consuming and complex. Teams must sift through detailed information, track overdue items, and ensure compliance – all of which takes attention away from innovation.

Imagine handling change records as effortlessly as discussing project milestones with your team – this is the transformative experience Joule brings to R&D operations. Joule simplifies interactions around change records, offering users intuitive access to detailed information at both header and item levels. By expediting the summarization process and enabling status changes, Joule ensures that overdue change records are discovered and addressed promptly, promoting efficient workflow and compliance. The capability to find records based on criteria such as product and reason for change further streamlines the management process, enabling teams to focus on innovation rather than paperwork. With these enhancements, R&D departments can make informed decisions more swiftly, driving their projects forward with the confidence that change management is both smooth and reliable.

 

For more details, refer to the dedicated pages on summarizing change record information and fetching change record information.

 

Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Streamlined project financials with Joule’s AI assistance

Handling complex financial data is one of the biggest hurdles in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management. Now, picture managing a multifaceted project with the ease of a friendly chat – that’s the vision Joule brings to life. With enhanced project assistant capabilities, Joule enables users to seamlessly access project financial and master data through intuitive natural language interactions. Gone are the days of toggling through applications and complex reports; now, project system users can effortlessly retrieve and summarize financial insights, aligning their focus on high-value tasks. This AI-driven ease not only boosts user satisfaction but also streamlines data collection and consolidation, making project management more efficient and effective. As a result, project teams can better navigate financial landscapes, ensuring that each decision supports the strategic vision. By leveraging Joule’s summarization and analytical prowess, organizations can enhance precision in project financial control, translating insights into impactful actions.


For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal. 

 

Summary

As we have explored, the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release introduces a transformative suite of AI-driven innovations that redefine what’s possible in enterprise operations. By harnessing the power of specialized agentic AI and Joule, businesses are now equipped to navigate complexities with clarity and precision, leading to optimized processes and strategic growth. We’re excited for you to experience these advancements firsthand and to see how they can empower your organization to achieve its goals with new-found efficiency and insight. Thank you for joining us on this journey through the future of intelligent enterprise solutions. Stay connected for more updates by following the with the PSCC_Enablement tag as we continue to innovate and shape the path forward for businesses worldwide. Don't forget to follow me (@Yannick_PTT) in the community as well as on LinkedIn to not miss any updates and insights.

For more information on intelligent capabilities integrated SAP Cloud ERP Private, explore the SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: Install custom functions in COHV (2/3)
entry.content:
Introduction

The previous episode demonstrated how to create and register a custom mass processing function code in COHV. Now it is time to implement the function.

SAP standard mass processing functions are implemented with COWORK<code> function groups, e.g. the function group COWORK230 implements the mass processing function 230 Close.

I am going to copy the function group COWORK170 to a custom function group and implement the custom mass processing logic there. Before that, let us execute a couple of preliminary steps.

I am trying to keep to SAP naming convention throughout all the subsequent steps.

 

Dialog structure creation

Copy the COWORK170_SETUP structure to ZCOWORK999_SETUP with SE11.

 

Function group ZCOWB999 creation

 

Function group ZCOWB999 adjustments

Now we need to scan the ZCOWB999 function group and replace all the artifacts of the standard COWB170 function group with our custom objects:

Find object…Replace with object…
CO_WORK170_CREATEZ_CO_WORK999_CREATE
CO_WORK170_DELETE<Z_CO_WORK999_DELETE
CO_WORK170_EXEC_SINGLEZ_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE
CO_WORK170_INITIALIZE_EXECZ_CO_WORK999_INITIALIZE_EXEC
CO_WORK170_SAVEZ_CO_WORK999_SAVE
CO_WORK170_SETUP_PAIZ_CO_WORK999_SETUP_PAI
CO_WORK170_SETUP_PBOZ_CO_WORK999_SETUP_PBO
CO_WORK170_UPDATE_INTERNZ_CO_WORK999_UPDATE_INTERN
COWORK170_SETUPZCOWORK999_SETUP
COWB170PARZCOWB999PAR

The easiest way to do that is to search for the source code of the ZCOWB999 function group for WORK170 string.

Here are my changes:

 

Custom processing logic

As we have copied the function group ZCOWB999 from SAP standard COWB170, for now it works exactly the same way as SAP original and executes the same mass processing logic. The mass processing logic starts at line 129 and ends at line 219 of the Z_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE function.

Let us replace that with same trivial test custom logic:

As you see my custom logic is just to log a message without any actual updates to an order. The goal here is to make sure that each order selected in COHV is processed by the function, that its number is correctly recognized and that the function correctly logs processing messages.

 

Testing

I am running COHV and choosing my 999 custom mass processing function:

Next, I am selecting a couple of production orders and execute the mass processing function:

Finally, I am displaying the processing log:

As you can see each of the selected orders have been processed by the Z_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE function, which logged the message.

 

Wrap up

The article presents a straightforward method to implement custom mass processing functions in the COHV transaction. Naturally, real life scenarios require actual production order updates, not just logging messages. The updates can be posted by production order BAPIs for instance.

We will look under the hood of mass processing in the next episode and explore more advanced topics like how the functions work together, processing parameterization or test mode. Stay tuned…

entry.title: Environment, Health, and Safety in SAP Cloud ERP Private | 2025 Release
entry.content:
Welcome to our deep dive into the latest advancements for Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release. I am thrilled to walk you through the key highlights for this release, collected in close collaboration with our product management teams.

This collection is part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025

 

These are the topics that are covered:

Environment Management

Emission Management:

  • A new overview page providing critical insights of the environmental management process

  • Support for standard, analytical content for the compliance overview

  • Reporting toxic chemical release data to publicly accessible databases such as the E-PRTR

Waste Management:

  • Integration of waste management and purchasing process

  • Integration of waste management and inventory management

 

Workplace Safety

Support for Occupational Health Processes

Incident Management Reporting:

  • Assignment of learning items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning using tasks created from incidents

Management of Change Processes:

  • EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

 

 

Environment Management 

Emission Management:

A new overview page providing critical insights of the environmental management process

Business Background
The Environment Management Overview page offers businesses a streamlined platform to gain insights into their environmental management activities. Managers can easily monitor performance focusing on key data issues like exceedances, warnings, and missing data collected over the past six months. This enables them to quickly identify areas needing attention and make informed decisions, ensuring alignment with compliance standards and supporting sustainability goals.

Key Features
Users can customize their SAP Fiori launchpad homepage to suit their needs, enhancing decision-making and data monitoring efficiency. The overview page allows managers to quickly access critical environmental data, facilitating prompt action to meet compliance requirements.

Image#1: Environment Management Overview

 

Support for standard, analytical content for the compliance overview

Business Background

In EHS Management, leveraging standard analytical content is essential for improving data-driven decision-making. By adapting existing CDS views, organizations can enhance the SAP EHS Management's environment management component. This enables thorough analysis of compliance data through SAP Analytics Cloud integration, allowing access to real-time data. Consequently, businesses can efficiently monitor tasks, track trends, and address environmental issues, helping managers maintain compliance and advance sustainability efforts.


Key Features
The innovation provides a live connection to the environment management system for immediate compliance data access, accelerating the transition from insight to action in daily operations. It also streamlines the experience for environmental managers by standardizing dashboard content, such as task overviews and trend analysis, aiding in efficient compliance management.

Image#2: Compliance Overview

 

Reporting toxic chemical release data to publicly accessible databases such as the E-PRTR

Business Background

Companies operating within the European Union are subject to stringent environmental regulations, including the mandatory reporting of pollutant releases to public databases like the European Pollutant Release and Transfer Register (E-PRTR). Compiling this data accurately from various sources and formatting it according to specific regulatory requirements is a complex task with significant risk for non-compliance. This new feature directly addresses this compliance challenge by helping to automate the preparation of E-PRTR report files. The system gathers the required data on air emissions, wastewater pollutants, and off-site waste transfers and can generate an initial XML report compliant with EU regulatory standards, significantly reducing manual effort.

Key Features

This feature supports the preparation and reporting of toxic chemical release data for companies in Germany, where the E-PRTR reports must be submitted via the BUBE online data collection software system. It enables the generation of an initial version of the required XML report based on collected environmental data.

Image#3: PRTR Facility Report

 

Waste Management:

Integration of waste management and purchasing process

Business Background

Effective waste management is not just an environmental obligation but also a complex logistical and financial process involving service procurement and timely payments. A lack of integration between environmental management and procurement systems can lead to payment delays, inefficient service acquisition, and poor financial oversight of disposal costs. This new innovation introduces a system that establishes a direct connection between the purchase order, the disposal channel, and the waste transportation document, enhancing the integration of waste management with purchasing processes.



Key Features

This innovation integrates waste management with other logistics processes like supply chain management and procure-to-pay. As part of this new innovation, it is now possible to link one or multiple existing purchase orders, enhancing the integration and efficiency of procurement processes.

Image #4: Manage Waste Disposal Channels

 

Image#5: Hazardous Waste Disposal Channel

 

Image#6: My Waste Transportation Document

 

Integration of waste management and inventory management

Business Background

For organizations that handle significant quantities of waste, managing on-site storage is a critical operational challenge. Knowing the exact location and inventory levels of different waste materials is essential for optimizing storage space, ensuring safe handling, and planning timely disposal shipments. Without a clear view of waste inventory, companies risk inefficient space utilization and potential compliance issues. To provide this much-needed visibility, waste management in SAP S/4HANA is now further integrated with inventory management, allowing for the precise tracking of waste inventory within the warehouse and enabling more efficient on-site storage and better shipment planning.

Key Features

This feature enables the tracking of the inventory of stored waste through deeper integration into inventory management. This provides organizations with greater insights into the specific amounts and storage locations of waste on-site.

 

Image#7: Manage Waste Transfer Requests

 

Workplace Safety

Support for Occupational Health Processes

Business Background

Maintaining employee health and well-being is a cornerstone of corporate responsibility and operational stability. Organizations require a systematic method to manage occupational health programs, from initial risk assessment to ongoing medical surveillance. A disjointed approach can lead to compliance gaps, increased health risks for employees, and significant administrative inefficiencies. This innovation addresses these challenges by providing a structured, integrated framework within SAP S/4HANA. It allows EHS managers and HR professionals to proactively manage employee health based on identified workplace risks, ensuring the right personnel receive the right medical attention at the right time and simplifying compliance management.

Key Features

This feature leverages a central repository to track the occupational health history and related case management for employees. It also drives a risk-based occupational health process with deep integration back to central HR data for comprehensive visibility.

Image#8: Edit Medical Service

Incident Management Reporting:

Assignment of learning items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning

Business Background

Following a workplace incident, a critical part of the resolution process is ensuring that employees receive follow-up training to prevent a recurrence. Manually assigning and tracking this training across different systems is often time-consuming and prone to error, which can delay crucial learning and compromise safety compliance. This enhancement streamlines the post-incident workflow by directly integrating incident management in SAP S/4HANA with SAP SuccessFactors Learning. When an investigation identifies a need for additional training, a task can be created to assign specific learning items to relevant employees automatically, ensuring a more responsive and effective safety culture.

Key Features

You can now assign learning content from SAP SuccessFactors Learning directly to employees via tasks created from incidents. The system automatically checks for the completion of these learning items and can complete the associated task, increasing transparency and efficiency.

 

Image#9: Assignment of Learning Items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning

 

Management of Change Processes:

EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

Business Background
To effectively manage change, it is critical to know precisely where the change is taking place, especially from an EHS perspective. Previously, linking change requests to a specific EHS-relevant location, such as a work center or storage area, was not possible, which limited the ability to search for and analyze all changes affecting a particular site. This made it challenging to ensure full interoperability between Management of Change and other EHS processes.

Key Features
You can now use the EHS location as a primary reference object within a change request, creating a direct and unambiguous link to a physical area. This enhancement significantly improves interoperability across the EHS solution area and enables more powerful search capabilities. Teams can now quickly and accurately find all change requests associated with a specific EHS location, enabling better oversight, more precise analysis, and a more integrated approach to managing site-specific changes.

 


Image#10: EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

entry.title: Organizational Changes in Accounting: Profit Center and Segment Reorganization
entry.content:
Are you already familiar with Organizational Changes in Accounting? What about profit center and segment reorganization?

Business Background

Organizational restructuring occurs when a company's business model changes due to internal or external factors. In these cases, restructuring is necessary and allows a company to adapt, survive, and ultimately grow.

In SAP S/4HANA, a company's organization is represented by reporting units, such as profit centers and/or segments.

What’s New?

As of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025, you can reorganize profit centers and segments for selected objects. During the reorganization process, profit centers and/or segments for these objects are reassigned and their stocks or balances are reposted to the new organizational entities.

In addition, some related apps for the Organizational Changes feature have been enhanced, new Customizing activities for segment reorganization are available, and new BAdIs are also available.

How can you use this feature?

First, ensure that you’ve made all necessary configuration settings in Customizing. Then, you can use the related apps. For more information, refer to Configuration Activities for Organizational Changes.

The Manage Organizational Changes app is designed to assist you in the reorganization process. Here, you define an effective date in the future, on which the reassignment of profit centers to other objects occurs. You can use this app to control the overall organizational change process and, from here, you can navigate to related apps for organizational changes.

Furthermore, reporting is available after an organizational change has been simulated or processed, and after it has been completed. You can use the available reports to analyze the effect of a reorganization as well as the corresponding reassignment of profit centers and/or segments.

Further Information

For more information about what’s new in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025, refer to What’s New for Organizational Changes in Accounting.

entry.title: Latest Features in the SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit, released with 2025 FPS0
entry.content:
Introducing the Latest Features in the SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA

We're pleased to introduce the newest features in the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit, released with SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS0 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 FPS0. These updates have been developed in direct response to customer feedback, aiming to elevate user experience and streamline migration processes.

New Staging and Direct Transfer Approach Features

Sequence Information View

A new feature is the Sequence Information View. This feature is designed to guide you in transferring data to your target system. It organizes migration objects in your project into a sequence for processing. This sequence is tailored to your specific project, depending on the migration objects you're working with.

By default, you'll see the Sequence Information View as your Start View, but you can easily switch back to the Standard View that you're used to.

Easier Access to Message Information

This improvement makes it simpler to navigate and access message-related information.

You can now easily trigger actions related to: 

  • Preparation Messages (only available for direct transfer): Get Information into the messages generated during Prepare Mapping Tasks.
  • Simulation Messages: Quickly access relevant information to better understand the outcomes of your simulation tasks.
  • Migration Messages: Get direct insights into the messages generated during the migration process, helping to troubleshoot and optimize your activities.
  • Migration Results: Access detailed information on the results of migration tasks, ensuring you have all the necessary data for review your migration tasks.

 These actions provide direct links to relevant message information, streamlining your navigation and increasing efficiency.

Server Group Assignment

This update offers you the ability to designate a specific application server or server group for your migration project, helping to ensure smooth operations without disrupting business activities.

To set this up, navigate go Job Management – Job Settings under the Option for Project. Here, you can select the application server or server group (if available) that best fits your needs.

Job Management

You now can adjust the number of background jobs assigned to specific migration objects, this offering a flexibility to streamline your data migration process according to your project's requirements.

To utilize this feature, go to Job Management under Jobs Used for Migration Objects, there you can see how many jobs are assigned to each migration object in your project.

Migration objects are categorized as following:

  • No Constraints: You can adjust the number of jobs assigned to the migration object.
  • Selection Process Only (1 Job for Simulation / Migration): Some objects, such as CO – Cost Center or CO – Profit Center, are limited to one job, so job adjustments aren't possible for them.
  • Staging Tables Not Prepared: Before adjusting job numbers, complete the Preparation step for these objects. (available for staging approach)
  • Status "Not Ready for Processing": If an object has this status, adjustments to job assignments are not possible

 For Staging approach, you can find more details in SAP KBA 294684 - SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit: List of Migration objects that doesn't support parallel jobs 

New Staging Features

Optimize Migration Performance

Migrating large volumes of data can be more efficient if you break it down into smaller packages. Once you've completed the "Prepare" step, you'll receive a recommendation on the number of jobs that can simultaneously handle a specific migration task. In the Job Management section, you have the flexibility to modify the number of background jobs dedicated to migration objects.

Efficient Error Handling When Uploading Template Files

The staging approach has been enhanced to display all sanity, duplicate, and consistency errors at once. This improvement means you no longer need to re-upload your file after each individual correction.

Any errors that arise during file upload are now provided in the template file, collected in the new “Messages” tab. In addition, a cell reference is available for each message which leads you directly to the error. After error correction, you need to delete the “Messages” tab and can upload the template file again.

See also following blog: SAP S/4HANA Migration cockpit: Easier Error Handling 

Correction File After Simulation

After a simulation ends with errors, you now have the option to use the "Create Correction File" action. This feature generates a file containing the specific instances of data that encountered errors during simulation.

This makes it straightforward to edit the issue-prone data within the file and re-upload it to the staging tables, like the Correction file feature available after Migration.

Download Template File (LTMOM)

You now have the capability to download Migration Object Template Files as CSV files, not only in the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit but also in SAP S/4HANA migration object Modeler (LTMOM).

 

New Direct Transfer (DT) Approach Features

Object Versions

The system will update the status of a migration object when a new version is available. While new versions of migration objects will contain new features or bug fixes, migration objects can also be deprecated or retired. The system will also update the status of such migration objects to inform you that they will be unavailable in future releases.

Define Split Logic (LTMOM)

To generate multiple entries in the target parameter for each entry in a source table, you can define a split. There are two types of split logic available to tailor this process to your needs:

  • Simple Split Logic
  • Advanced Split Logic

 For more detailed information please see:

  • SAP Note: 3595079 Defining Split Logic - SAP S/4HANA Migration Object Modeler , especially the detailed guide attached
  • Blog from Philipp Kreutzheide: SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit – Migrate Directly from SAP – Increase flexibility using Split Logic

Event Based Rules (LTMOM)

Event-based rules offer the capability to execute ABAP code at specific point of processing. To set up an event-based rule, you need to map a source table to a target parameter. Moreover, the target parameter must be a table, or a structure of type Importing, Changing, or Tables.

Class Based Source Code Rules (LTMOM)

Class-based source code rules offer an advanced option for defining how source values are transformed to target values. By creating an ABAP class with your own logic, you can create a class-based source code rule that utilizes this class. Additionally, these rules allow you to directly call other rules within the source code.

Utilizing Where Conditions Editor (LTMOM)

The WHERE Conditions Editor enables you to define additional selection criteria across all fields in a table using Open SQL statements. You can use AND and OR operations to build simple or complex conditions. You can leverage all ABAP Dictionary data types, with the exception of STRING, RAWSTRING, LCHR, and LRAW.

More details you can find in SAP KBA 3249988 - Details on selection process - SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Direct Transfer

Instance Field List (LTMOM)

You can define how migration object instance is displayed in the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit. They are available under Instance List Settings button on the detailed screen for your root table.)

New Migration Objects

For details on the new migration objects, please check:

  • SAP S/4HANA – Release Comparison of Migration Object Templates (Staging Table)
  • SAP S/4HANA - Release Comparison of Migration Objects (Direct Transfer)

entry.title: Service Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 Release
entry.content:
This blog shares highlights on Service Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 Release, showcasing how these innovations address critical business challenges in service delivery, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction.

The innovations in this blog are a part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025.

You can find an overview of selected innovation highlights across all lines of business in the blog posts below:

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights by Bert Schulze

AI-innovations in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 by Yannick Peterschmitt

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Release Highlights by Harish Mangtani

 

Core Service Management Enhancements

  • Plant and storage location in service transactions
  • Service team determination based on custom attributes
  • Tool items in service transactions
  • Copying additional contract items from service contract templates
  • Service with advanced execution: navigation link from maintenance order to service order
  • SAP Fiori apps for maintenance management in Service with Advanced Execution
  • Resource-related cost items in Service Order for Advanced Execution

AI-Powered Service Intelligence with Joule

  • Joule: Provide summary of service delivered for a given equipment
  • Joule: Enhancements to service orders
  • Joule: Enhancements to Service Confirmations – Complete & Cancel
  • Joule: Search and create follow-ups for in-house service objects
  • Searching, navigating to, and managing service contracts with Joule

Operational Excellence Features

  • Ad hoc billing plan enhancements
  • Consistent settlement of hierarchies, including settlement to cost-based CO-PA
  • Enhanced shipping of in-house service objects
  • Intracompany logistics for in-house service objects
  • Additional supports for products in quantity
  • Extensibility Fiori app F7695 "Manage In-House Services"
  • Changing service contracts in mass
  • OData v4 APIs for Service Order, Service Confirmation, and Service Quotation
  • Simplifying transition to service contract management via migration object in migration cockpit

 

Plant and Storage Location in Service Transactions

This feature introduces dedicated, editable fields for Plant and Storage Location at the item level of service transactions. Planners and coordinators can specify where service work is performed or staged for each line item, ensuring that follow-on logistics and financial processes use the correct plant and storage location. This makes multi-plant and multi-location scenarios easier to model and manage across quotes, orders, and confirmations.

This increases flexibility in service execution, reduces manual corrections, and aligns downstream logistics and accounting, helping teams accelerate fulfillment and improve data quality.

Screenshot: Plant and storage location in service transactions

Service Team Determination Based on Custom Attributes

Service team determination now supports custom attributes in assignment rules. Administrators can include factors such as product line, region, priority, customer tier, or organization-specific attributes to drive automated routing. The rules reflect how your service organization operates, ensuring service orders and requests are assigned to the best-fit team from the start.

This offers more flexibility to model determination rules based on customer requirements, enabling more-precise routing, fewer reassignments, and stronger SLA adherence.

Screenshot: Service Team determination based on custom attributes

Tool Items in Service Transactions

Service transactions can include tool items to capture specialized tools required to deliver a service. Tool usage is represented as dedicated line items, enabling both external billing (where relevant) and internal cost allocation. This ensures tools are planned, accounted for, and settled alongside labor and materials in a standardized way.

This extends service process coverage by supporting tool items, creating clearer cost tracking and standardized planning for engagements that rely on specialized equipment.

Screenshot: Tool Items in Service Transactions

Copying Additional Contract Items from Service Contract Templates

Users can enrich existing service contracts by searching and selecting items from approved service contract templates during extensions or changes. A guided copy capability lets teams add reusable building blocks to contracts quickly and consistently, reducing the need to create items from scratch.

This streamlines contract changes, saves time, lowers error rates, speeds responses to customer requests, reduces administrative effort, and enables scaling without a proportional increase in workload.

Screenshot: Copying Additional Contract Items from Service Contract Templates

Service with Advanced Execution: Navigation Link from Maintenance Order to Service Order

Advanced Execution harmonizes asset and service management by enabling the asset management phase model for billable maintenance orders and providing direct navigation to related service quotes or service orders. Approval workflows are supported within the phase model for both scenarios, creating a controlled, end-to-end flow for billable work across maintenance and service.

This creates functional alignment between asset management and service management, supporting smoother handovers, improved visibility, and more-governed execution for billable work.

 

SAP Fiori Apps for Maintenance Management in Service with Advanced Execution

Modern SAP Fiori apps can be used to handle billable maintenance processes within the Advanced Execution scenario. Enabled capabilities include displaying, status changes, and scheduling of billable maintenance orders (where applicable) using apps such as Manage Maintenance Orders, Find Maintenance Order, Find Maintenance Order and Operation, Manage Components and Services, Maintenance Backlog Overview, Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets (including the new version), Manage Maintenance Backlog, and Manage Maintenance Notifications and Orders (for phase-enabled orders). This brings an aligned user experience between maintenance and service.

This makes it easier to adopt service-relevant innovations from maintenance management, reduces training complexity, and increases efficiency through a consistent user experience across maintenance and service.

Screenshot: SAP Fiori Apps for Maintenance Management in Service with Advanced Execution

Resource-Related Cost Items in Service Orders for Advanced Execution

Service Orders display resource-related cost items (RRCIs) based on planned data. When the process starts with a Service Quotation, RRCIs can be copied to the Service Order (per copy control) and refreshed or redetermined from the latest planning data in the corresponding billable maintenance order using the Refresh Planning action. If starting directly with a Service Order, RRCIs can be generated and later refreshed from maintenance order planning; Refresh Planning is available until the first release of the Service Order.

This supports accurate cost estimation and pricing by carrying planned costs and markups forward from quotation to order and keeping them current with the latest maintenance planning data.

Screenshot: Resource-Related Cost Items in Service Orders for Advanced Execution

Joule AI-Powered Service Management

Joule: Provide Summary of Service Delivered for a Given Equipment

Joule provides a conversational, consolidated view of equipment-related service information, including Equipment Service Report, Service History, Basic Details, and Warranty Information. Users can retrieve these insights without navigating multiple apps, streamlining planning, execution, and customer interactions from a single entry point. Available only with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition.

This speeds up information access and decision-making at the point of service, helping technicians and managers reduce app switching and resolve issues more quickly.

 

Joule: Enhancements to Service Orders

Joule now supports richer interactions with service orders via natural language: search using additional criteria, jump directly to an order’s item overview, and perform status actions such as complete, business complete, reopen business, reject, or set in process. Users can also complete or set individual items to in process and display item list information—all through conversational prompts. Available only with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition.

This enables faster, centralized handling of service orders and items, reducing clicks and cycle time while improving throughput and control.

 

Joule: Enhancements to Service Confirmations – Complete & Cancel

Joule adds conversational capabilities for service confirmations: search confirmations, display transaction history at header and item levels, and complete or cancel confirmations directly. Available only with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition.

This centralizes confirmation processing and history, speeding administrative steps, reducing errors, and helping ensure timely, accurate handling.

 

Joule: Search and create follow-ups for in-house service objects

This innovation transforms service object management through conversational AI. Service managers can now use natural language to search for in-house service objects across the system, eliminating the need to navigate through multiple screens or remember specific transaction codes. The AI understands context and intent, allowing queries like "show me all service objects for customer ABC" or "find repair items pending approval." Beyond search, Joule can automatically create follow-up documents such as service orders, quotations, or delivery documents based on conversational prompts. This reduces manual data entry, minimizes errors, and accelerates service processing workflows.

This human-centric approach optimizes the daily workflow of service managers. It boosts efficiency by streamlining object discovery and follow-up creation, reducing clicks and time-to-action.

Graphic: Joule: Search and create follow-ups for in-house service objects

Searching, navigating to, and managing service contracts with Joule

Joule extends its AI capabilities to service contract management, enabling users to perform complex contract operations through natural language requests. Users can ask Joule to "create a service contract for equipment maintenance" or "cancel contract SC12345 due to customer request," and the system guides them directly to the appropriate functionality. This eliminates the learning curve for new users and reduces the time experienced users spend navigating the system. The AI provides contextual guidance throughout the process, ensuring compliance with business rules and reducing processing errors.

The benefit is faster navigation and task execution for contract-related processes. Teams get specific answers and direct access to actions, lowering the effort needed to manage contracts and improving user satisfaction.

 

Operational Excellence Features

Ad hoc billing plan enhancements

The system now performs comprehensive validity checks on ad hoc service contract items, automatically verifying that billing values align with net values. When discrepancies are detected, users receive immediate notifications with detailed explanations of the variance. Additionally, organizations can now create reusable ad hoc billing plan templates that can be copied into new billing plans, standardizing billing processes across similar service contracts. This enhancement significantly reduces billing errors, improves financial accuracy, and enables faster contract setup through template reuse.

These safeguards improve billing accuracy, reduce discrepancies, and minimize manual oversight. The result is more reliable financial records, greater customer trust through consistent billing, and time savings that allow teams to focus on strategic tasks.

Graphic: Ad hoc billing plan enhancements

Consistent settlement of hierarchies, including settlement to cost-based CO-PA

Service orders and contracts can now be automatically settled to both margin analysis and costing-based Profitability Analysis (CO-PA), providing comprehensive financial visibility. This dual settlement approach enables organizations to analyze service profitability from multiple perspectives - understanding both direct margins and comprehensive cost structures. The integration supports hierarchical service structures, ensuring that complex service arrangements with multiple levels are properly reflected in financial reporting. This enhancement enables more informed pricing decisions and better portfolio management.

The ability to leverage either margin analysis or cost-based CO-PA provides deeper insights into service transaction profitability. It centralizes reporting, supports nuanced analysis, and informs pricing and portfolio decisions.

 

Enhanced shipping of in-house service objects

Organizations can now assign specific ship-to parties to in-house service objects and configure alternative shipping addresses at both service and object levels. New shipping attributes are automatically transferred to outbound deliveries, ensuring seamless logistics coordination. This flexibility is particularly valuable for multi-location service operations where objects may need to be returned to different customer sites or service centers. The enhancement streamlines post-service logistics and reduces exceptions in delivery processing.

Service managers gain more flexibility when returning in-house service objects to customers and better control over outbound deliveries. These enhancements streamline logistics and reduce exceptions in post-service handoffs.

Screenshot: Enhanced shipping of in-house service objects

Intracompany logistics for in-house service objects


This innovation enables seamless transfer of service objects between plants and storage locations within the same company code. Objects can be received via standard delivery processes and displayed with clearly defined location information. The system provides full visibility into logistics-related documents and supports flexible stock management by allowing selection between customer stock B and returns order stock E. This capability improves asset utilization, reduces manual coordination efforts, and strengthens traceability throughout the service lifecycle.

This innovation enables smooth transfers across locations, improves visibility of current object location, and integrates inbound and outbound logistics steps. It reduces manual coordination and strengthens traceability.

Screenshot: Intracompany logistics for in-house service objects

Additional supports for products in quantity

The system now maintains synchronized quantities between returns order items and in-house service objects, ensuring data consistency across all related documents. When returns order item quantities change, corresponding in-house object quantities update automatically. Subservice objects are now displayed directly below main objects in relevant applications and can be sorted by item number for improved usability. This synchronization eliminates quantity discrepancies and provides service managers with accurate, real-time information for decision-making.

The result is consistent returns processing and enhanced usability. Service managers can rely on accurate quantities and clearer lists, reducing errors and speeding up operational tasks.

Screenshot: Additional supports for products in quantity

Changing service contracts in mass

A new application supports bulk updates to service contracts, including mass repricing, party changes, and automated processing through background jobs. Multiple contracts can be processed simultaneously, with the system handling complex business logic and validation rules. This automation significantly reduces administrative overhead for large-scale contract modifications, ensures consistency across contract portfolios, and enables rapid response to market changes or organizational restructuring.

By automating bulk changes, companies reduce manual maintenance effort and administrative cost. It ensures consistency across contracts and speeds up large-scale updates with minimal user intervention.

Screenshot: Changing service contracts in mass

Extensibility Fiori app F7695 Manage In-House Services

Organizations can now define custom fields and add them to the user interface while maintaining adherence to SAP S/4HANA standards. Custom logic can be created and maintained to enhance application behavior without compromising system integrity. This extensibility enables customer-specific solutions while preserving upgrade compatibility, reducing the need for separate custom developments and accelerating tailored enhancements.

Organizations gain flexibility to deliver customer-specific solutions without diverging from standard. This reduces the need for bespoke developments elsewhere and accelerates tailored enhancements.

Screenshot: Extensibility Fiori app F7695 Manage In-House Services

OData v4 APIs for Service Order, Service Confirmation, and Service Quotation

New OData v4 A2X APIs replace deprecated v2 versions, offering improved performance and expanded functionality. The v4 APIs include additional properties and entities, such as follow-up service order items and partner functions at the quotation item level. These modern APIs provide better processing efficiency, reduced resource consumption, and enhanced integration capabilities for external applications. The upgrade future-proofs connectivity and enables richer integration scenarios.

Modernizing integrations with OData v4 improves processing time and resource consumption on both client and server. Expanded properties enable richer scenarios and future-proof connectivity for external applications.

 

Simplifying transition to service contract management via migration object in migration cockpit

A dedicated migration object in the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit supports standardized data migration from legacy contract management solutions through staging tables. This reduces transformation complexity, minimizes migration risks, and accelerates time-to-value for organizations transitioning to SAP S/4HANA Service Management. The standardized approach improves data quality and shortens the path to operational readiness.

This reduces transformation risk and cost by streamlining migration projects. A standardized object accelerates data onboarding, improves quality, and shortens the path to operational readiness in service contract management.

Screenshot: Simplifying transition to service contract management via migration object in migration cockpit

More information

entry.title: SAP User Experience Update: What’s New for SAP S/4HANA 2025 (Private Cloud and On-Premise)
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA 2025 comes with a whole host of user experience innovations and improvements.  Web access via My Home and the SAP Fiori launchpad has many useful improvements, as does SAP Mobile Start for mobile access. Joule gives conversational access to Private Cloud Edition using natural language, now also with analytical insights. There are additional collaboration capabilities, and many improvements in details: some towards providing a more consistent and integrated SAP Business Suite, some simply making a user’s life easier. Finally, design and UI technology is also advancing, with powerful AI support for developers now available.

This post covers:

  • UX Updates for Consistent and Integrated Business Suite
  • Web access: My Home and SAP Fiori launchpad
  • Mobile access: SAP Mobile Start
  • Joule
  • Situation Handling news
  • AI-Assisted capabilities: outlook
  • New collaboration capabilities
  • UX improvements in details
  • UI adaptation improvements for key users
  • Design and Technology news

If you want to get an impression of how good SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, looks across all the main product areas, have a look at the online Product Tour.

Since this post covers what’s new, building on the previous 2023 release, you might want to have a look at the UX innovations which came with the Feature Pack Stacks 00, 01 and 02 of the 2023 release:

  • SAP User Experience Update: What’s New for SAP S/4HANA 2023 (Private Cloud and On-Premise).
  • User Experience Advances with SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01 (Private Cloud and On-Premise).
  • SAP User Experience Q4/2024 News for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023.

For a full overview of what’s new since the FPS00 shipment of the 2023 release, have a look at the documentation (note that it includes features from the above 2023 FPS01 and FPS02 blog posts, as well as this one):

  • What’s New for SAP Fiori launchpad for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

 

UX Updates for Consistent and Integrated Business Suite

We aim to provide a consistent and integrated experience for all users of the SAP Business Suite, which means providing an entry point for users to access all the various SAP products within the suite, and ensuring that the user experience across these products is consistent, making it easy for users to use applications from different products.

Entry Points

Figure 1 shows our approach for providing a web and a native mobile entry point to the products of the suite, such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud. I’d like to highlight that Joule can also be seen as an entry point to access the entire suite, since our goal is to provide Joule wherever you are, be it in our web applications or native mobile apps. Using Joule, our goal is to allow users to query and perform actions on all the products and applications which they are authorized to use, simply using natural language. As you’ll see below, we are making good progress towards this goal.

Figure 1: Entry points providing an integrated workplace for accessing the SAP Business Suite. Alt Text: Image showing Joule on the left, “available web and mobile”, and on the right a diagram with boxes indicating that SAP Mobile Start, SAP Start, and SAP Build Work Zone provide central access to SAP, with three boxes below for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP SuccessFactors and Other SAP Products.

Web Central Access

I have covered recent UX innovations in our web central entry points, such as SAP Start and SAP Build Work Zone, and central services such as SAP Task Center, in my recent cloud UX blog posts. Since these capabilities also apply to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition as well as SAP S/4HANA (except for SAP Start), I will not repeat them here, but rather refer you to them:

  • SAP User Experience Q1/2025 Update – Part 1: Many New Innovations Available (AI, Joule and More).
  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

 What we will look at in this post in detail are UX innovations for local access from web or mobile, via My Home and the SAP Fiori launchpad, and via SAP Mobile Start. Each has a dedicated section further below.

Design Updates for Suite Consistency

To achieve consistency across the suite, we have made design improvements which are relevant for a consistent user experience across the entire SAP Business Suite, and which are now available with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 and SAP S/4HANA 2025. As I mentioned in my April blog post Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web), consistency of the user experience across the various applications used by a user is an important part of overall usability, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products – no unexpected surprises.

In this section, we’ll look at four design updates provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad, as well as examples of the new design for illustrations:

  • Navigation menu: Side navigation
  • Updated shell bar
  • Updated user menu
  • Updated notifications
  • New illustrations design

Navigation Menu: Side Navigation

Many SAP products already offer a navigation menu on the left of the screen, a pattern already familiar to many people. Hence, we have decided to apply that approach to navigation across the SAP Business Suite in upcoming releases.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA, the side navigation is displayed as an overlay, as you can see in Figure 2. It gives you direct access to your favorite apps, either directly or via the folders you have created. It also gives you direct access to your Spaces and Pages. The previously available menu to access all your spaces and pages along with personalization options is available via the entry “All Spaces” at the bottom of the menu.

A big benefit of this new navigation menu is that you can now access your favorite apps directly from any application. Previously, you would have to return to My Home and then click on your favorite app, now you can access it directly from the menu, as shown in Figure 2.

Figure 2: The new navigation menu, opened up from the new shell bar, showing direct access to Favourite Apps, My Spaces and All Spaces. Alt Text: an image showing a list of sales orders and on the left a pop-over with a navigation menu with the sections already mentioned. Below the “Favourite App” eight apps are listed as well as two folders for favorite apps, plus the folder “Insights” for the insight tiles.

New Shell Bar – need to switch it on!

The new shell bar design for the SAP Business Suite is available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. The immediately visible difference is that now the product name is displayed to the right of the SAP Logo, in this case “S/4HANA Cloud” as you can see at the top of Figure 2. The logo and the name are all contained within a clickable area, which brings the user to the start page (e.g. My Home).

The new shell bar enables the next two design updates to the user menu and to notifications.

By default, after upgrading, the old shell bar will be shown, with the new navigation menu. We advise that you check any test automation and RPA (Robotic Process Automation) you may have before switching on the new shell bar, since you may need to make some adjustments – in particular if you log off at the end of a test.

You can switch on the new shell bar via the Activate New Features application, with the feature “/UI2/SHELL_BAR_TOGGLE”.

New Situation Handling Framework Capabilities

Already with the 2023 release we made it possible for partners and customers to create their own situation objects with ABAP Development Tooling (ADT) via developer extensibility. This becomes even more powerful with the 2025 release, with the extended framework supporting the collection of data context, support for custom objects in your own use cases, and support for the standard translation option. Let’s have a look at these in a bit more detail.

Data Context supported by the Extended Framework

The data context is business data from business objects involved in a situation instance that can be collected, distributed, and used for advanced analytics – for example using the Monitor Situations – Extended app. If enabled in a situation type, data context is collected when a situation instance is created, updated, or completed. For example, If you use the situation template Quantity Deficit in Supplier's Delivery to inform specific members in your purchasing organization about a deficit in the quantity of materials to be delivered by the supplier, you'll get, for example, the material, plant, or supplier as part of the data context.

With the 2025 release, every extended object-based situation template supports data context. You can activate it in the Manage Situation Types - Extended app. Doing so results in an event being triggered that includes the data context every time a situation instance is created, updated or completed.
